description: Installation of 1 x Fascia Sign (externally illuminated) and 1 x projecting sign (internally illuminated) (Advertisement Consent)
decision_conditions: SCHEDULE 1: CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE REGULATIONS
a. The consent shall expire after a period of five (5) years from the date of this notice.
b. Any advertisements displayed and any site used for the displays of advertisement shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
c. Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
d. Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
e. No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

f. No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any of traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).

Reason: To ensure the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by artificial lighting, in accordance with Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and PLG05 Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements (2015). | SCHEDULE 2: CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY AUTHORITY
a. The consent shall expire after a period of 10 years from the date of this notice.
b. The minimum duration of each image to be no less than 60 seconds.
c. The maximum interval between successive advertisements to be less than 1 second.
d. Successive messages shall be non-sequential, in that they should not contain additional information to the previous message (certainly for non-public information display purposes).
e. Messages shall not contain phone numbers, email/internet addresses (which would include sites like twitter and Facebook) or text numbers (certainly for non-public information display purposes).
f. Images shall be entirely static and contain no moving images.

g. Each of the advertisement screens hereby approved shall be fitted with the specified light sensors which shall control the brightness at all times. During the daytime period (between local sunrise and sunset) the brightness of the screens shall be controlled to be no more than 3500 Nitts/sqm. During the nighttime period (sunset and sunrise) the brightness shall be controlled to be no more than 350 Nitts/sqm.

h. In the event of a failure the display will default to an output level no higher than that which has been conditioned to be the acceptable maximum under normal operation. If this cannot be achieved, then the display should be required to default to an "off" position until the problem can be resolved.
i. Maximum level of illuminance to be set to 300cd/m2 (for more than 10m2) and 600 cd/m2 (for no more than 10m2) in accordance with ILP Guidelines/

Reason: To ensure the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by artificial lighting, in accordance with Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and PLG05 Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements (2015).
